column4: I was formatting my existing ubuntu 10.04 and doing a fresh install (last time it was an upgrade) . I am run into a problem. I got the message "Unable to install grub in /dev/sda".. I selected the option of continuing without a bootloader option...Now I need to mannually install the bootloader.. how do I do it?
how can I manually install a bootloader in ubuntu
you can't if you can't boot into ubuntu...you'll have to boot into another system if you have dual/multi-boot
I do not have dual boot
I have the installation CD. do you think I can manually install the boot loader from the installation CD
I was checking the version of grub on my machine and it says GNU GRUB 1.98-1ubuntu10.
Neither can I find menu.lst nor grub.cfg when I mount the hard drive from the install CD
did you try the steps on the web page listed above?
I was trying the steps in the website. One of the steps was to "Go into boot/grub directory and check for the existence of the files menu.lst and grub.cfg.   "
ok, and which /boot/grub dir did you try? the live cd or your installed partition?
remind me again - did you install grub before?
I had been using this version of ubuntu for some time now. I wanted to do a fresh install. So I formatted the whole disk from the installation CD..
and when you installed afresh, did you not install grub?
Thats when I got a fatal error. so I had to skip the grubn installation
then in that case, ignore steps in the web page instructions relating to previous grub installations...you don't have a previous install, so there would be no /boot/grub menu
